intro: Astragalus kochakii, commonly known as the Persian milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Astragalus kochakii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various health benefits.
